H0.text: In Christian art what does a painting termed a ‘Pieta’ depict. The Virgin Mary weeping alone

H1.text: In Christian art what does a painting termed a ‘Pieta’ depict. A group of angels surrounding Jesus

H2.text: In Christian art what does a painting termed a ‘Pieta’ depict. Jesus Christ standing after resurrection

H3.text: In Christian art what does a painting termed a ‘Pieta’ depict. Mary holding the dead body of

A4.text: The Pietà depicts the Blessed Virgin Mary cradling the mortal body of Jesus Christ after his Descent from the Cross.

A5.text: The Pietà is a specific form of the Lamentation of Christ in which Jesus is mourned by the Virgin Mary alone.

A6.text: The sculpture captures the moment when Jesus, taken down from the cross, is given to his mother Mary.

A7.text: The marks of the Crucifixion are limited to very small nail marks and an indication of the wound in Jesus' side.
